meanings.definition: The ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions.
meanings.sent1: Her judgment in choosing friends is always wise.
meanings.sent2: I trust your judgment on this matter.
meanings.sent3: His judgment in fashion is questionable.
meanings.sent4: Her judgment is like a compass guiding her through life.
meanings.sent5: Good judgment is a valuable trait to possess.

meanings.definition: An opinion or conclusion reached after careful consideration.
meanings.sent1: My judgment is that we should go with option B.
meanings.sent2: What is your judgment on the new restaurant in town?
meanings.sent3: His judgment on movies is always spot-on.
meanings.sent4: Her judgment on the matter was as clear as a bell.
meanings.sent5: In matters of taste, everyone has their own judgment.

meanings.definition: The legal process of reaching a decision or verdict.
meanings.sent1: The judgment in the court case was fair.
meanings.sent2: The judge's final judgment was awaited anxiously.
meanings.sent3: The judgment in the courtroom was swift.
meanings.sent4: The judgment in the trial was like a thunderclap.
meanings.sent5: The judgment of the court was final and binding.
